page.title: 04Shouldham-Children's pets.
page.content: Most families have pets of some kind.The most popular ones are dogs and cats.Some children have their own pets to look after and from our sample these include gerbils,stick insects, rabbits and hamsters. The larger pets, such as horses are "shared",with some of the girls having riding lessons followed by caring for the animals. Only one child has their own pony, whilst one family has a retired sea-side donkey.The children who own rabbits have helped to make their hutches and collect grass and dandelion leaves to feed them. Many of these pets come from local pet shops and in Swaffham,on Saturdays,there is a market which deals with rabbits,goats and chickens.
